titlestmt.subtitle: Inventory of Records
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Connecticut State Library staff.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Paul E. Baran on March 05, 2013

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Voluntown, New London County, Town established in 1721

The Voluntown Probate District was constituted June 4, 1830, from the Plainfield Probate District. The Voluntown Probate District merged with the Norwich Probate District on April 3, 1889 to create an enlarged Norwich Probate District which serves the municipalities of Bozrah, Franklin, Griswold, Lisbon, Norwich, Preston, Sprague, and Voluntown.
Town of Voluntown, Probate District chronology:

May 1721 - May 1726, New London District
May 1726 - May 1747, Windham District
May 1747 - June 1830, Plainfield District
June 1830 - April 2, 1889, Voluntown District
April 3, 1889 - Present, Norwich District
For Probate Court contact information and hours of operation see, .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Probate record books volumes 1-5, 1830-1889. See Alternative Form Available note below.

Probate files, 1830-1876. Probate files may consist of estates, conservatorships, guardianships, commitments, and insolvencies. See Alternative Form Available note below. Probate files after 1876 are filed with Norwich Probate Court probate files (Accession 1914-007).

Inventory control book, 1830-1889 (coverage). Also known as the Godard Digest, it is a list of probate files transferred to the Connecticut State Library. It was compiled at the Connecticut State Library under the direction of State Librarian George S. Godard.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Record books in accession 2011-063 are arranged numerically 1-5.
Probate files in accession 1914-010 are arranged alphabetically.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aid
otherfindaid.p: Record Books: Index cards for the record books have been scanned. Ask History and Genealogy staff for assistance. See Alternate Form Available section for volumes available on microfilm.

Probate Files: The Probate Estate Papers Index, located in the index corridor adjacent to the History and Genealogy Reading Room, has two parts, a general index covering most of the state, and a Hartford Probate District index covering Hartford and some surrounding towns, 1820-1920. The index cards are arranged alphabetically by individual's last name and first names. The cards have the individual's name, town of residence, probate district, and list of items contained in the estate packet. To request retrieval of an estate packet, copy at least the estate name, file date, and probate district name from the index card. The probate files in Accession 1914-010 are represented in this index.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Researchers should first consult use copies when available. See Alternate Form Available Section below.
Accession 2011-063, Record books, 1830-1889, is stored at an off-site facility and therefore may not be available on a same-day basis.

Probate files dated 1921 or later are RESTRICTED pending review by State Archives staff as they may contain confidential documents. Tax returns (succession, transfer and estate tax returns and all attachments) from January 1, 1921 and later are confidential per Connecticut General Statutes §12-15. Adoptions (all documents) from January 1, 1944 and later are confidential per Connecticut General Statutes §45a-754. Removals of parent as guardian of minor (all documents) and terminations of parental rights (all documents) from October 1, 1975 and later are confidential per Connecticut General Statutes §45a-754. Contact State Archives staff for assistance. Adoptions (all documents) from January 1, 1944 and later are confidential per Connecticut General Statutes §45a-754. Contact State Archives staff for assistance.

altformavail.head: Alternative Form Available
altformavail.p: Record books, volumes 1-5, 1830-1889; probate files, 1847-1876 (Accession 1914-010); and inventory control book (Godard Digest) were microfilmed by the Genealogical Society of Utah and are available for use in the History and Genealogy reading room or through the .

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The probate files in accession 1914-010 were transferred to the Connecticut State Library on the following dates (with date span of files): May 5, 1914 (1831-1876).
The record books in accesion 2011-063 were transferred to the Connecticut State Library on November 30, 2010.
